patterns.provider_pattern: Context providers wrap children and follow the pattern: create context, export custom hook, provide context value. See ToastProvider and ThemeProvider.
patterns.component_structure: Named exports for components, TypeScript interfaces for props, functional components with hooks
patterns.mui_components: Use Material-UI components (Alert, Button, Box, Typography) for consistent UI styling
patterns.error_handling: Axios interceptors handle API errors, ToastProvider shows user notifications, but no Error Boundaries exist for React component errors

existing_implementations.description: Found comprehensive provider pattern in ToastProvider.tsx and ThemeContext.tsx. No existing Error Boundary implementations found (confirmed by grep search).
key_insights: ToastProvider demonstrates how to wrap app with context providers in main.tsx
Material-UI Alert and Snackbar components already in use for notifications
React 18.2.0 supports Error Boundaries via class components or react-error-boundary library
Main.tsx has provider hierarchy: BrowserRouter > ThemeProvider > ToastProvider > App

error_boundary_requirements.description: Need to create Error Boundary that catches JavaScript errors in component tree and shows user-friendly fallback UI
error_boundary_requirements.placement: Wrap the App component in main.tsx (after ToastProvider, before App)
error_boundary_requirements.fallback_ui: User-friendly error message with recovery action (reload button)
error_boundary_requirements.implementation_approach: Use class component with componentDidCatch and getDerivedStateFromError lifecycle methods, or use react-error-boundary library
